Dear Ms. Williams:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
04/11/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective aciton plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio
(4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the
direct supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable
interval, eye-on checks of residents. The time
between the variable interval checks shall not exceed
fifteen minutes.
A random sample of bed check logs showed that staff were not performing eyes-
on checks of youth within variable fifteen minute intervals.
CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care,
all of the following information shall be documented in
the case record within 14 days after discharge:
(b) A brief summary or other documentation of the
services provided while in residence, including
medical and dental services.
Two out of two discharge service plans reviewed did not contain a brief summary
of services provided by the program.
2

CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care,
all of the following information shall be documented in
the case record within 14 days after discharge:
(c) An assessment of the resident's needs that remain
to be met.
Two out of two discharge service plans reviewed did not contain narrative
assessing the youth's needs that were still to be met.
CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care,
all of the following information shall be documented in
the case record within 14 days after discharge:
(d) Any services that will be provided by the facility
after discharge.
Two out of two discharge service plans reviewed did not contain descriptions of
the services to be provided by the facility after discharge.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
No technical assistance was requested or required during this inspection.
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was provided in the area of the facility's working relationship with law
enforcement and the CCI rule specifying no weapons being allowed in living areas of
the facility. An additional area of consultation regarded the organization of paperwork
for discharged youth.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There was one substantiated incident of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. One investigation during this report period produced a confirmation of
maltreatment in care. The investigation covered an incident where a staff member
was transporting youth in a facility van and drove recklessly, resulting in an
accident and injuries to youth. This staff member's employment was terminated,
and the coinciding Licensing investigation produced a corrective action plan.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: One
3

corrective action plan was approved during the report period, resulting from a
special investigation (SIR #2024SIC0001361). The rule violation from this
investigation was regarding the facility's policies related to staff driving youth. The
action steps in this CAP included the termination of employment of the staff
member involved, and repeated training on facility driving policy and driving laws.
The facility has been found to be in compliance with these action steps and related
licensing rules.
Financial Overview
The organization’s most recent financial audit for 2023 and a current budget was
reviewed, and no concerns were noted about the organization.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Annual Assessment, dated 04/04/2025, was provided and
reviewed. Described were systemic factors that have impacted rule compliance
efforts, including an influx of new staff and contractual changes that changed the
type of youth served by the program. Programming and training changes have
been a result. One corrective action plan was reviewed and the facility felt that the
action steps in the CAP had been beneficial. There were no unplanned discharges
during this past year.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff were interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face visit at the facility on
04/11/2025. They expressed positive experiences working at the program.
Training was adequate and staff felt supported and able to connect with the youth.
Youth were interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face visit at the facility on
04/11/2025. Youth had limited negative things to say about the program. They felt
their basic needs were being met, communication outside of the facility was
afforded properly and the programming they were working through had been
explained well to them.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through was completed during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the
facility on 04/11/2025. No youth were present in the house at the time of the walk
through because they were in school. The house was in clean and organized
condition and no concerns were noted. Youth had ample space to themselves and
for group activities and recreation.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
